{"step_by_step_thinking": "Vasoactive amines are substances that can cause blood vessels to dilate and increase vascular permeability. One of the main cells that release vasoactive amines is mast cells. Mast cells are found in connective tissues and are involved in allergic reactions and inflammation. Leukocytes, macrophages, and fibroblasts do not typically release vasoactive amines. Therefore, the correct answer is C. Mast cell.", "answer_choice": "C"}
